ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Point of subjective equality : parameter obtained after fitting the psychometric curve to the stimuli and responses from the bisection part
Point of subjective equality - min of the 95% confidence interval
Point of subjective equality - max of the 95% confidence interval

Just noticeable difference: second parameter obtained after fitting the psychometric curve. Intuitively, the lower this parameter, the more sensitive a participant is at discriminating two time durations
Just noticeable difference:   min of the 95% confidence interval
Just noticeable difference:  max of the 95% confidence interval

Weber fraction =JND75/PSE. Intuitively, a trait-like measure of sensory precision for a participant. The lower this value, the higher the participant's precision in discriminating lengths of time intervals
Weber fraction: min of the 95% confidence interval
Weber fraction: max of the 95% confidence interval
Slope in the Wide Medium (WM) stimulus condition - regression slope of estimated duration via presented duration. we used the Matlab function 'robustfit'
Slope standard error in the WM stimulus condition, also output from 'robustfit'
Slope in the Narrow Medium (NM) stimulus condition - regression slope of estimated duration via presented duration. we used the Matlab function 'robustfit'
Slope standard error in the NM stimulus condition, also output from 'robustfit'
Slope in the Narrow Short (NS) stimulus condition - regression slope of estimated duration via presented duration. we used the Matlab function 'robustfit'
Slope standard error in the NM stimulus condition, also output from 'robustfit'
